treatment.taxon_hierarchy: family Asteraceae;tribe Gnaphalieae;genus Antennaria;species friesiana;subspecies alaskana;
treatment.description: Dioecious (staminates and pistillates in equal frequencies in populations). Plants 7.5–14 cm. Stolons 0.5–1 cm. Cauline leaves 4–20 mm. Heads 2–6. Involucres: staminate 4–6.5 mm; pistillate 5.5–7 mm. Corollas: staminate 2.5–3 mm; pistillate 3–4.5 mm. Cypselae 1.2–1.8 mm; pappi: staminate 3–4 mm; pistillate 3.5–5 mm. 2n = 28, 56.

habitat_info.text: arctic and alpine tundra , on or near dry rocky outcrops or sand ridges ;
habitat_info.habitat: arctic and alpine tundra on or near dry rocky outcrops or sand ridges

treatment.discussion: Subspecies alaskana is dioecious (sexual) and known from Alaska and cordilleran areas of northern Yukon and adjacent Northwest Territories (R. J. Bayer 1991, 1993). It is a probable progenitor of the Antennaria alpina complex.
